card.note: Whenever I've needed advice about a car, a vacation or a book to read, I turn to you and have received great advice as well as conversation.
card.author: Love, Carmen

card.note: You've instilled in me as well as others a deep appreciation of the importance of history.
card.author: Love, Carmen

card.note: I have always felt blessed to have such a loving, supportive, wise, funny, knowledgeable, kind, and inspiring father. Thank you for being such a wonderful part of my life!
card.author: Karl

card.note: Good brother. We share the same wonderful parents. We loved you, Barb and your children, happy Fathers Day. Believe in the magic of tomorrow.
card.author: Majel and Dick

card.note: One thing I like most about Gerald is his fierce loyalty to his family. His parents, children, siblings, & in-laws were always first in his life. I've always known he'd stand up for me whenever I needed him./RHappy Father's Day, Gerald!/R /R
card.author: Arlene Feight

card.note: Well..... for a fat guy, he doesn't sweat much...
card.author: One quarter Swede living in Norway

card.note: I have so many fond memories of staying at the farm in the Summer with my favorite cousin! Little did we know how well we would be as fathers!
card.author: Richard

card.note: Hi Dad! Happy Father's Day! I want you to know that I still have, and treasure, both letters you sent to me at St. Olaf, at the beginning and end of my time there. I have them both at hand, and refer to them often. You're the best dad anyone could ask for.
card.author: Love, Paul

card.note: My uncle Jerry is simply the best uncle a nephew could ever have, bar none. In addition to being an uncle, he is my Godfather and a very valued mentor and friend. He has offered guidance, support and humor to me throughout the last 45 years of my life. I am thankful!
card.author: Geoff (Weffer)

card.note: I am proud to have a very fun and interesting uncle in Gerald Anderson. He has always helped me better understand my Scandinavian roots and place in the world.
card.author: Greg Hall, of the Lake Elmo Halls

card.note: I have always admired Jerry's devotion to Barb--the two of them were soul mates and it was obvious to everyone who knew them.
card.author: Love, Pete

card.note: "Fatherhood will put a man through a lot, but it's a tremendous job, the best in the world - even better than playing basketball."/R/R
card.author: Derek Fisher

card.note: "Fatherhood is pretending the present you love most is soap-on-a-rope."/R/R/R
card.author: Bill Cosby

card.note: “A father has to be a provider, a teacher, a role model, but most importantly, a distant authority figure who can never be pleased. Otherwise, how will children ever understand the concept of God?”
card.author: Stephen Colbert

card.note: "When I was a boy of 14, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be 21, I was astonished at how much he had learned in 7 years."
card.author: Mark Twain

card.note: "I have found the very best way to advise your children is to find out what they want to do and advise them to do it."
card.author: Harry S. Truman

card.note: "It is a wise father that knows his own child."
card.author: William Shakespeare

card.note: "My father said there were two kinds of people in the world: givers and takers. The takers may eat better, but the givers sleep better."
card.author: Marlo Thomas

card.note: "Old as she was, she sometime still missed her daddy."
card.author: Gloria Naylor

card.note: "My daddy, he was somewhere between God and John Wayne."
card.author: Hank Williams, Jr.

card.note: "I believe that what we become depends on what our fathers teach us at odd moments, when they aren’t trying to teach us. We are formed by little scraps of wisdom."
card.author: Umberto Eco

card.note: “The greatest mark of a father is how he treats his children when no one is looking.""
card.author: Dan Pierce

card.note: “My father gave me the greatest gift anyone could give another person, he believed in me.”
card.author: Jim Valvano

card.note: “When my father didn’t have my hand, he had my back.” /R
card.author: Linda Poindexter

card.note: “There should be a children’s song: ‘If you’re happy and you know it, keep it to yourself and let your dad sleep.’”
card.author: Jim Gaffigan

card.note: “Even very young children need to be informed about dying. Explain the concept of death very carefully to your child. This will make threatening him with it much more effective.”
card.author: P.J. O'Rourke

card.note: "There are times when parenthood seems nothing more than feeding the hand that bites you."
card.author: Peter DeVries

card.note: “Dad always thought laughter was the best medicine, which I guess is why several of us died of tuberculosis.”
card.author: Jack Handy

card.note: “They don’t grade fathers, but if your daughter is a stripper, you f---ed up.”
card.author: Chris Rock

card.note: “I have always had the feeling I could do anything and my dad told me I could. I was in college before I found out he might be wrong.”
card.author: Ann Richards

card.note: "I think the saddest day of my life was when I realized I could beat my Dad at most things, and Bart experienced that at the age of four."
card.author: Homer Simpson

card.note: “Kids are great, Apu. You can teach them to hate the things you hate and they practically raise themselves now-a-days, you know, with the internet and all.”
card.author: Homer Simpson
